txt.en: This plaque is not the answer to the riddle
This plaque is not the answer to the riddle
The last of Twisttongue's riddles is here, outside, beneath the sun
Falgeirr's riddle has brought you on a long journey through the great halls of Moria, and at last you are come to the final pieces of the puzzle.

A riddle, in Falgeirr's strange written language:

Dwarf walketh over,
Dwarf walketh under, 
In time of war,
Dwarf burneth asunder.

Solve Falgeirr's riddle:

Dwarf walketh over,
Dwarf walketh under.
In time of war,
Dwarf burneth asunder.

Ulfkell believes that the answer to Falgeirr's riddle lies somewhere within the great Chamber of Records, known also as the Chamber of Mazarbul.

Solve Falgeirr's penultimate riddle:

My first is a snake,
My second, a bowl;
My third is in nail and urn and knoll,
And if you've a quick and ready mind,
The last clue of Falgeirr beneath me you'll find.

To determine where to seek the plaque that solves Twisttongue's next riddle, you should decipher the meaning of his words.
'I believe the answer to this riddle lies somewhere in this very chamber.'
'The answer to the last riddle, I believe lies beyond the East-gate in the Dimrill Dale.'
